reviews.title: Nice restaurant....service could be a bit quicker
reviews.text: We are staying in a cottage nearby so decided to try the restaurant in this hotel. Nice choice of starters and main courses and a nice view from the restaurant of the nearby loch. My starter was a little bland (hot crab, could have done with a kick of flavour, lemon etc...) but main (steak) was tasty. My 2 travelling companions really enjoyed their meals. Service was a little slow but only 2 staff on, the veg could have come out a bit quicker with the main meals. Comfy seating area in the bar, would go back but would try different meals next time.

reviews.title: Average
reviews.text: This was not the intended place to stay but was where I stayed. The view was lovely. Wi-Fi was not available every place in the hotel and not in my room. I sat for nearly 3 hours doing necessary correspondence on e-mail in a very cold hallway. The lights in the hallways were not illuminated by the staff at night, but I finally found a light switch in the last hallway after feeling my way up the previous flights. The room was clean. The food was satisfactory as was the service. Staff was friendly. Parking was convenient.

My daughter and I had a 2 night break here after travelling from Caithness. We were given a room on the ground floor which would have had a terrific view of the loch if we hadnt had to look over the car park. Suggest anyone booking this hotel asks for an upper floor for the view but there is no lift.
reviews.title: Bit out of the way

reviews.text: The room was comfortable but furniture a bit dated and we did have a small deck outside the patio door.
reviews.title: Its Cold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception area also doubled as a bar but there was limited seating we went round to the pub attached to the hotel. Mistake. Food was expensive and bar needed complete renovation.
reviews.title: big mistake because of food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was fine even with a French party being there. They ate early so we were well looked after after they went. The view was lovely as we were upgraded to a front room and the staff were lovely.It is a bit remote, but we went over to Plockton on the second night and that wasn't too far.
reviews.title: Balmacara

reviews.text: Greeted by an englishman at the desk who juggled the prices before squeezing an extra tenner out of me the Balmacarra was a Hotel that might once have been quite nice. The room was dated and didn't lock, I had to sit in a corridor outside an office to pick up wi-fi and they couldn't be bothered to start breakfast half an hour early for me and 7 other guests. Not good enough and poor value. Keep going there are plenty good B&Bs on Skye.
reviews.title: Poor service at the Balmacarra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our twin room for 65 GBP (for 2) on booking.com, but noticed a sign in the lobby that said the rack rate was about double that. We had a great view, buffet breakfast, with the usual Scottish breakfast items. Large room and you could set the temperature. The only negatives (and for the price I'm not complaining) was that there was an odd variety of different styles of furniture in the room and there also was no lift so had to use stairs with our cases.
reviews.title: Great view, great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If your main objective is to explore isle of Skye and its surroundings, Balmacara Hotel is not the place to stay. it is charmless, the rooms look like a big dorm and it is too expensive. The location is poor. There is nothing nice around in a walking distance. Prefer to get a bed and breakfast in Isle of Skye or Stockton (charming village!) that you will have a much better experience, with nice rooms, the chance to interact with the nice local people for half of the price. The only reason for staying here it would be if you are traveling in a big bus with a huge group of people...
reviews.title: Not worth it. Too expensive for what it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel, staff, food and facilities are great. We were well looked after. As we stayed out of season we managed to miss the coach tours which I believe are frequent but I am assured don't interfere with other residents. We had a beautiful view from the room which was very clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Base for Touring

reviews.text: In total, I stayed at 7 different hotels in Scotland on this trip, and this was one of the best places I stayed. The food was good, the views were fantastic, there were well groomed trails, a store right next door with a post office in it. My 20 yr old son had a small room in back with a view of a parking lot, and he liked this place better than any place we stayed. personally I wouldn't go that far, but I really liked it for it's charm. I would definitely go back!
reviews.title: I liked it in spite of it's shortcomings

reviews.text: Good location. Pleasant welcome and a rather nice room with a comfortable bed and a decent-sized bathroom. Window view over a low roof to the loch. The restaurant was fine, with white table cloths and well-polished cutlery and glassware. Good, generous and unfussy food. Breakfast nice (but no kippers on offer). Mix of business guests and tourists - not too busy in June. Had to stock up on some essentials for lunch etc., so the little supermarket next door was handy. Didn't try the pub that belongs to the hotel. Maybe next time.
reviews.title: A nice hotel with a Spar (next door)!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location with excellent views. Great base for visiting other locations. Room was clean and good size. Breakfast was good, good portions. Ate both in the pub next door and the alacarte both good but alacarte better. Staff friendly and helpful. Very relaxing atmosphere.
reviews.title: Anniversary weekend

reviews.text: Got told room number at time of booking and this is what we got -great view
reviews.title: Coach Driver Opinion (Professional Traveller)

reviews.text: I've only visited here for lunch on tours before however my first night in the hotel was more than comfortable.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem right outside Kyle of Lochalsh

reviews.text: My husband and I choose Balmacara Hotel to have our wedding reception after our ceremony in Eilean Donan Castle. We stayed at the hotel from the Friday to Monday with our guests staying Sat-Mon.... throughout the whole process of organising the wedding Helen was on hand to help us as was Liz and Andrew, made it easy for us and put our mind at rest as we are from Glasgow so had to rely on them a lot to help us with organising. The staff really made our stay enjoyable and from the moment we arrived we received a top class service, Helen was around to talk through all the plans and make sure that our wedding ran smoothly! The food was delicious and the views from the hotel breath taking, all of our guests thought the setting was gorgeous! We stayed in room 35 which was beautiful, spacious and looked out onto the loch.
reviews.title: Wedding Party

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel and we will be returning for many anniversary's to come!
reviews.title: One night stay

reviews.text: Thanks to all the staff at Balmacara, you helped make our big day very special! :)
reviews.title: Nice, little hotel in a beautiful spot in the Highlands

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made a mistake when booking and thought our first hotel was on Skye, so when we got over the shock of arriving on the island by boat and 20 mins later leaving over the bridge, we arrived at the hotel, very nicely situated on the loch, our twin room was clean and big enough for 2 tired travellers, lovely bath and large bathroom, our 2nd mistake was to drive into town and eat at one of the hotels there with no atmosphere, should have gone to the bar,the only complaint I have is our room was just above the large spotlight and we could not darken the room to go to sleep.It would have been nice to know on arrival that the wifi was not available in the room, we tried for ages to connect, when we could have gone to the lobby.
reviews.title: A great stop over

reviews.text: I have a problem with stairs and there is a lot of them to carry luggage up.
reviews.title: Have dinner in the hotel!
